fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class KeepAliveBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<SessionBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.KeepAliveBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<KeepAliveOptions>, Parent<SessionBuilder>

    public class KeepAliveBuilder
extends AbstractParent<SessionBuilder>
implements Builder<KeepAliveOptions>
    Builder to configure how keep alive session management should behave.

    Keep alive actively maintains the session opened by sending regularly EnquireLink messages. This builder let you configure:

    • Enable/disable active keep alive management
    • The time to wait between two EnquireLink messages
    • The maximum time to wait for a response from the server for EnquireLink request
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public KeepAliveBuilder enable(Boolean enable)
        Enable or disable sending of EnquireLink messages to keep the session alive.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using enable(). 

         .enable(true)
 .enable()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
 
         .enable(true)
 .enable()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        In both cases, enable(true) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable sending requests to keep the session alive
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • enable

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<KeepAliveBuilder,Boolean> enable()
        Enable or disable sending of EnquireLink messages to keep the session alive.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .enable()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)

        Non-null value set using enable(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .enable(true)
 .enable()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        The value true is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • interval

        public KeepAliveBuilder interval(Long delay)
        The fixed delay (in milliseconds) between two EnquireLink messages.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using interval(). 

         .interval(60000L)
 .interval()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(30000L)
 
         .interval(60000L)
 .interval()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(30000L)
        In both cases, interval(60000L) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        delay - the amount of time to wait between two EnquireLink messages
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

        public KeepAliveBuilder responseTimeout(Long timeout)

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • connectAtStartup

        public KeepAliveBuilder connectAtStartup(Boolean connectAtStartup)
        Connect to the server directly when the client is ready (if true). Otherwise, the connection is done when the first message is sent. This may be useful to avoid a latency for the first message. If connection fails at startup, then a new attempt is done when first message is sent.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using connectAtStartup(). 

         .connectAtStartup(true)
 .connectAtStartup()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
 
         .connectAtStartup(true)
 .connectAtStartup()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        In both cases, connectAtStartup(true) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        connectAtStartup - try to connect when client is ready
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • connectAtStartup

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<KeepAliveBuilder,Boolean> connectAtStartup()
        Connect to the server directly when the client is ready (if true). Otherwise, the connection is done when the first message is sent. This may be useful to avoid a latency for the first message. If connection fails at startup, then a new attempt is done when first message is sent.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set).

      • executor

        public KeepAliveBuilder executor(Supplier<ScheduledExecutorService> executorFactory)
        Provides a factory that creates an ScheduledExecutorService. The created executor is then used to schedule the task that sends EnquireLink requests. The factory should use one of:
        • Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor()
        • Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory)
        • Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(int)
        • Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(int, java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory)

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        Parameters:
        executorFactory - the factory that creates an executor to use
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • executor

        public KeepAliveBuilder executor(ScheduledExecutorService executor)
        Provides an ScheduledExecutorService. The executor is then used to schedule the task that sends EnquireLink requests.

        This method is a shortcut to executor(() -> executor).

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        Parameters:
        executor - the executor to use
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • maxConsecutiveTimeouts

        public KeepAliveBuilder maxConsecutiveTimeouts(Integer max)
        The maximum number of consecutive timeouts to EnquireLink requests to consider that a new session is required.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using maxConsecutiveTimeouts(). 

         .maxConsecutiveTimeouts(5)
 .maxConsecutiveTimeouts()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(3)
 
         .maxConsecutiveTimeouts(5)
 .maxConsecutiveTimeouts()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(3)
        In both cases, maxConsecutiveTimeouts(5) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        max - the maximum consecutive timeouts
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • defaultEnquireLinkTimerFactory

        public static Supplier<ScheduledExecutorService> defaultEnquireLinkTimerFactory()
        Default factory that provides a ScheduledExecutorService executor. As only one thread is needed (only one task) to regularly send EnquireLinks, it uses Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor(ThreadFactory).

        The thread is named EnquireLink-<generated number>.

        Returns:
        the factory
